Reviews.Title: “Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ade1442
Reviews.Content: Very lovely Inn, large room with fireplace, small balcony, coffee maker, frig, comp water. Large bathroom with skylight which could use an update. Side chairs in room need to be recovered but overall it was nice and clean. Comp breakfast was also good. Walking distance to good restaurants and shopping. Also try Model Bakery, bread and deserts are delish.

Reviews.Title: “Super inn!, great find!”
Reviews.Author: Cousj
Reviews.Content: Over the years we always stayed in Yountville at our favorite inn, well now we have found the only place we'll be staying at, Inn at Southbridge in St Helena. They make you feel so at home and appreciated. Breakfast is all you'd ever want, room with fireplace, large screen TV, large room and comfy bed with nice thread counts too. Walk out the door and the best spa, life fitness gym is right there with outdoor large heated lap pool. Manager, Marcelle and staff are very knowledgeable about the wine area and wineries to visit. We loved having the village right there in walking distance with many many stores with great shopping. John& Judy , Gainesville

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: yarny
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute for the Sunday of President's weekend. In comparison to all the other hotels available this had the most reasonable rate, but still not cheap. The hotel is very convenient to downtown St. Helena, Tra Vigne and Merryvale vineyards. The room was spacious, had a working fireplace which was very nice, and a small refrigerator. The bathroom was fine, but basic. The room could use some color or artwork. It was very bland. The turn down service provided cookies and two bottles of water, which we appreciated after wine tasting all day. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet. This is not the place to stay if you are looking for a hotel with great grounds and lots of amenities. Otherwise it was fine, nothing really bad, but nothing really great either.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: paymoto
Reviews.Content: It was valentines day weekend and a lot of places were sold out or required a two night stay so I picked the Inn at Southbridge. I didn't have very high expectations but it was very nice. Our room was huge and had a fireplace which was a nice tough. The bed was very comfortable. The location is fabulous because you can walk to most of the St. Helena restaurants and it is right across from Gott's Roadside. The breakfast was basic but nice with lots of fresh fruit, yogurt and some pastries. Overall I think it was a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Hawkmoon209
Reviews.Content: I was up with some coworkers for our company retreat in October and was not impressed in the slightest. The service was good but the rooms were certainly not up to par with the price. The furnishings were old and tattered, the tv old (not flat panel or flat screen), and the bathrooms were worst of all - a stark white hospital bathroom with one tiny, metal, airplane sink and no counter space. I have stayed at numerous places in Sonoma/Healdsburg area including Sonoma Mission Inn, Healdsburg Hotel, Kenwood Inn - all luxurious with wonderful service. To be honest, I've stayed at Holiday Inns that were more luxurious than The Inn at Southbridge. Had we paid in the $100 range per night then it would have been fine but this was not the type of hotel I expect when I pay over $400/night. Some good points - the service was good and the pool/fitness center excellent. I will say that they were extremely prompt addressing my concerns/complaints and told me that they were currently upgrading many rooms. However, if they are well aware that the rooms need updating/modifications than they shouldn't charge the luxury prices to begin with.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: frf18
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the inn, while my son was recovering from surgery, and was pleasantly surprised by the overall quality of the experience. The regular king size room was huge, and had a cathedral ceiling, which added to the spacious feeling that was unexpected in a standard king room. It was tastefully decorated and immaculately clean. The bed was super comfortable and the quality of the linens was very high. I appreciated the large bottle of complimentary spring water each morning, and the small bedside bottles of water with the turn down service each evening. The service at this inn was nothing short of amazing. There was nothing the front desk wouldn't do to make your stay more pleasant, and always with a smile. Marcelle helped us with scanning documents, faxing, and even found a charger for our computer! T They keep menus of the local restaurants on hand to help you decide where to have lunch and dinner. Susan's recommendations were excellent. Breakfasts were in a small, lovely room and included freshly baked goods from the local bakery. Be sure to try the English muffins, which were actually a cross between a doughnut and a muffin. The location of this inn is perfect, as it is on Main Street, within a short walking distance of restaurants, boutiques, a pharmacy, nail salon and the spa. No need to drive after having plenty of wine with dinner! I will definitely return - this place felt like home, after just a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: bruce g
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant place to stay in Napa. Rooms are comfortable with charming features including fireplace, balcony, vaulted ceilings and more. The location is perfect...walking distance to wineries, shops and restaurants in St Helena. Situated right off of Rt 29 and easy access to Silverado Trail. Staff was very attentive. Full service spa and fitness facility including a heated lap pool and superb staff right next door. This is not what I would call a "high end, luxury" hotel. More of a low-key inn with no pretense. We enjoyed our stay and would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn At Southbridge was the best ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Inn At Southbridge and we loved it from the minute we arrived to the minute we left!!! The staff was amazing, the location couldnâ€™t have been more perfect, the rooms were incredible with a huge cozy bed and a romantic fireplace. We loved the balcony that looked onto the beautiful green courtyard. We felt so relaxed our entire stay. The continental breakfast was like no other continental breakfast I've ever had - there was lots of fresh fruit with incredible baked goods. The Inn was very accommodating in every way. We throughly enjoyed the spa and pool which was 10 feet across the courtyard from our hotel. The staff at the spa was amazing and the pool was beautiful! We'll be back in the near future!!

Reviews.Title: “This was an amazing home away from home. We were celebrating my 65th birthday. The staff was so warm and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Ericsons086
Reviews.Content: We were there two nights. I would not change a thing. The room was always clean and comfortable. We slept 11 hours on the comfortable bed. We will definetly return. Beautiful place!! This Inn was walking distance from downtown - reminded us of being in a European Inn. Amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Large Rooms, but not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: liam045
Reviews.Content: The hotel has only 21 rooms, all on the second floor of what looks like a converted office bullding. The entrance is at the opposite end of the building that you would expect. You have to drive through the parking lot and then notice the awning, which is on the end of the building on the first floor. The lobby has no space to speak of--no chairs to relax in or coffee tables, and no bathroom. There is no restaurant or bar. There is no help to bring your suitcases inside. You have to grab a cart and wheel it out to your car. You use the one elevator to take the cart to the second floor and wheel it down the hall. The hall is spare, and smelled a lot like fresh paint when we were there. The room was the best part- very large with a vaulted ceiling and a fireplace. The bathroom was ok---nothing to write home about, but serviceable. It had a skylight, which is nice. There was a refrigerator-mini bar. There is a very small balcony overlooking another nearby building and a courtyard, and beyond you can see cars on the highway constantly and trains going by occasionally about 150 ft away The room cleaners had a lot of used towels and other materials in the hallway--I expect a neater cart than that. The TV was ok, but on the small side, and not flat screen. Another good thing was the free breakfast. This was acutally pretty good, with cereal, pastries, fruit, coffee, and orange juice. You also get free wine tasting at the very nearby Merryvale winery. We didn't use that so can't report on that experience. Overall, it was clean and neat and well located but not 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations were too high and so the result was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ECB2010
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect example of reality not quite living up to hype. The hotel is very nice and located in a beautiful part of California's Napa Valley. The main street is a short walk / drive away and there is an abundance of great restaurants and quaint shops. Moreover, the Culinary Institute of America along with some of the best vineyards are within easy reach. However, the hotel is listed on the Small Luxury Hotels of the World website and so my partner and I were expecting something far more luxuries, far more impressive, and set in a much better environment. This trip was arranged to coincide with my partner's birthday and so I wanted something truly memorable. As a consequence we felt slightly misled and let down by the actual property. Had our expectations been different the actual experience would have been far better. For those looking for convenience and comfort this is the place. For those looking for something truly special I would encourage a wider search.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like upscale Marriott - a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: katieL87
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because it was listed as a Small Leading Hotel of the World, but it felt more like an upscale Marriott. Our expectations were probably a little high, which is why we didn't react that well to the hotel. The room was alright, and the highlight was the wood-burning fireplace in the room. When we return to Napa, we will most likely stay elsewhere. It was clean, and the bed was comfortable, but probably not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms Need TLC”
Reviews.Author: SLS065
Reviews.Content: This is a great location right in the middle of Napa Valley Wine Courntry. It was a very hot weekend (Upper 90's) and our room was cool. At night we opened the patio doors which made for pleasant sleeping. We stayed in the room with the single patio door by the fireplace that is pictured in the slide show of the hotel. The chairs were very dirty with torn arms, and ripped backs. This was a pleasant experience but not a value at the $450 per night that you would expect out of a 5 star hotel. We'll try other hotels in the area on furture trips to the wine courntry..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lmccabe
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect-next to Merryvale winery, and across from a great burger stand, close to shopping in St. Helena. Workout facility was clean and updated. Rooms were clean, large, and had patios and woodburning fireplaces. Breakfast was included. Probably the worst thing was that our room overlooked the parking lot, but if you looked beyond the parking lot, you could see wineries.....

Reviews.Title: “great location - nicely staffed - could use some tlc”
Reviews.Author: sanfrann
Reviews.Content: birthday getaway for bay area couple - my husband does business with restaurants in the area, so we stay in the Napa and Sonoma area four or five times a year. we hadn't stayed in st. helena for a while and had seen the ads for the inn at southbridge a few times - decided to try it. The good news - great location walkable to restaurants and to downtown st. helena. nice spa on property with lap pool and nice facilities that are gratis to hotel guests. nice beds and linens. The bad news - looks like they ran out of money in constructing the place - ok so i'm fussy but....large cracks in cement sinks and tile floors, floorboards left unfinished; one side of hall finished, the other side not (??), stickers left on light fixtures, fluorescent tubes plainly visible in bathroom where a piece of glass was quite obviously missing, furniture worn and dirty, cheaply finished doors. Wireless internet as advertised not working, cheap bath fixtures and faucets, rough towels in bathroom (overly laundered; time to buy new ones!), breakfast was fresh fruit which was very nice along with yogurt, granola, and cereal and pastries - which was FINE for me, but many would feel shorted if "breakfast" is advertised when eggs, etc are not included. I dunno - lobby was fine, the front desk was quite nice and helpful, but the physical plant was lacking. I wanted to like it, but it's just not there yet. Perhaps when the market gets back together someone can buy some new towels and have the furniture cleaned; buy some prints or art for the walls? our view was a parking lot, as were half of the hotels' view...

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: kmh200886
Reviews.Content: We visit wine country twice a year, and generally stay in Sonoma. We wanted to stay in St. Helena this time, and decided on the Inn becauase of a huge discount rate we got. The Inn is nice, but nothing spectacular. It is located right along the road, and shares a parking lot with many other businesses (more of a "motel" feel than a wine country getaway). Definitely doesn't have the "old world" European feel like some other places. Room was comfortable, but again, nothing unique. Breakfast consisted of a self-serve buffet of fruit, pastries and cereal. Overall, okay experience. Definitely would NOT pay the rack rate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: winemyst
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn at Southbridge Mid January. CA was experiencing a dry/sunny-spell and the weather was beautiful. The location is awesome. The Inn is in the heart of St. Helena, and is convenient to at least 20 wineries (short drive). Merryvale is right next door, Taylors refresher is across the street and Travigne is on the other side of merryvale. The room was large and comfortable. The breakfast in the morning is fresh and delicious, fresh pasties and baked goods, strawberries, pineapple, coffee, juice, cereal, yogurt. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We had a late flight and wanted to visit more wineries after we checked out, but did not want to leave the wine we had purchased in the car all day. The front desk stored our wine, for the day. We were on our honeymoon and the concierge made reservations at three restaurants for us. She did a great job because, each restaurant celebrated our honeymoon with us, we received champagne and dessert free. It was a special touch. Highly recommend this Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Member1978
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Inn at Southbridge and it was amazing! It's a cute property - not too big. We had a room which faced the inner courtyard, which was great. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are good (not modern, but still very nice). The bed was super comfortable, especially their sheets! The area is nice, too, very close to the wineries and great restaurants. All in all, a great time and hotel. If you join the SLH club, you get discounts at the spa and other benefits. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Holiday Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DeeBlue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn during our Christmas vacation. It was wonderful. The staff, both front desk as well as housekeeping, were pleasant and very accommodating. (Polly in particular was a doll!) The breakfast treats were fresh and delicious and the cookies they left in our rooms were amazing! The room was lovely complete with a fireplace and vaulted ceiling. The location was perfect for our first trip to Napa, as there were tons of great vineyards in the immediate area. Twomey, was one of our favorite small tours. Castillo di Amorosa was especially interesting as it was a reconstructed Italian Castle! Amazing! The Wine Spectator Greystone restaurant, part of the Culinary Institute of America is right down the road also. We had a great meal there. Also great for casual dining we liked Pizzera Tra Vigne right at the Inn. Across the street is Taylorâ€™s Refresher, a great old fashion drive-in, recently featured on the Food Networkâ€™s "Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives." Worth the wait in line! Our stay was magical and helped to make for a very memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: lakemurrayscfan
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! The Inn at Southbridge is a wonderful spot to stay when visiting Napa Valley. St. Helena is the most marvelous town and there are world class restaurants within an easy walk from the Inn - so no driving after tasting all day! Service is the strong point at the Inn. Kevin gave us wonderful suggestions for dinner, picnic supplies (skip Dean and DeLuca -- Go to Sunshine Foods right across the street - it's so much better) and made our reservations for tours and tastings. Staff at the Inn helped us ship our purchases back -- effortless travel as a result. Rooms are well appointed with nice linens, bath amenities, and fireplaces. Continential Breakfast was a pleasant surprise -- delicious fresh fruit, breads, muffins, yogurt and granola. Big plus here is the use of the incredible fitness facility right next door. This was the second time my husband and I had stayed here and this time we brought two other couples with us. You always worry that someplace has "changed" since you stayed there last but I can confidently say it was even better than we remembered. We will be back (again!).

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Holly511
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Southbridge is a fabulous place to stay in St. Helena and we will definately go back. The staff was very accommodating and the morning breakfast is great! Guests can use the pool and fitness facilities at the Health Spa Napa Valley right next door. St. Helena is the most charming town in Napa with great shopping and restaurants. The Inn has the best location for walking everywhere - Martini House, shops, Market and Tra Vigne is really close. Now Tra Vigne does have great atmosphere and the food is good, but it is also expensive. The Pizzeria is actually in the same building as the Inn, and while we heard it was good, we did not get a chance to try it. We did go to Taylors Automatic..across the street...and while good, not quite as amazing as we had heard. Also - make sure to get a room that is not on the Main road, otherwise you will get to hear when everyone's order is ready. A note on Balloons Above the Valley - very professional, but they use a very touristy and unappealing location for their "champagne brunch". If you want to go ballooning, they all cost about the same and have brunch - so ask about where it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Zero Character”
Reviews.Author: Mlogs
Reviews.Content: This property has just about everything you can ask from a small luxury hotel. You will have no trouble being comfortable here. The Inn's rooms are spacious, well decorated, and cozy. This coupled with a full spa next door make the Inn at Southbridge a great choice for those staying the area. The final plus would be the location, from the Inn you have easy walking access to all of St. Helena's restaurants and dining. With that said I was disappointed by the almost complete lack of that intangible quality, character. The hotel seemed to lack life and artistic direction. The Inn will be a great stay for all but the property itself will fade quickly from memory.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Small Hotel Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Tinabel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 2 nights with another couple. Although this was a very nice, clean hotel, I still felt that for $400+ per night there should have been MORE. But I guess compared to other hotel/motel/inns, this was a good value since Napa is expensive. The rooms were large with fireplaces, but an actual patio with a table and chairs would have been nice to enjoy the outside. The included breakfast was great for a continental breakfast...good pastries, fruit and coffee. One morning we wanted eggs for breakfast and went to Gilwoods--great food! But again, it would have been nice to have an outside area to enjoy breakfast instead of the small room off the lobby. The fitness center and spa across the way were very nice and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: superusta
Reviews.Content: My Husband booked Inn at Southbridge for my 30th birthday Napa getaway. The hotel was much more casual than we were expected. Our room was really clean and comfortable, and we had a fireplace in our unit:) When my husband booked the room, he told the stuff that we will get there on my 30th birthday, so there was a complimentaly vintage local wine and box of chocolate waiting for us on the table when we got there. It was really nice of them. The bed was comfortable and the room was really quiet that we slept very tight until 9:00am....we went to bed around 10:00pm(1am for us since we are from east coast). We had a complimentaly breakfast on the 1st floor next morning and had delicious muffins and coffee:) It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: NVRam123
Reviews.Content: We love the Inn at Southbridge, this was our second stay. Friendly staff, very clean rooms, contemporary design, great location, spacious rooms, cool spa, and a pretty good rate for Napa. We couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “I'd do it again”
Reviews.Author: buhusky
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the beginning of August in 2006. Was pretty hot (mid- to upper- 90s) but the hotel was very nice. Staff was very friendly, helpful & professional. Breakfast was basically continental style but all of the pastries (made locally) and fruit were fresh and very good. Very few rooms in the hotel so you never really see anybody other than staff. Spa is literally 10 feet away and recommended. Hot rocks massage & honey glow were our choice and definitely enjoyed. Tra Vigne is a local restaurant (actually two restaurants - one is a pizzeria and the other is a very good regular restaurant) within about 30 seconds walking distance. One winery is right there as well, although the others in the area are about half a mile away. Definitely won't hurt for wineries within a few mile range and almost all are open 10-6 and don't require any appointment so don't worry about that. Yountville is a quaint town about 10 minutes away, worth walking around in on a nice night to just relax. Would definitely stay again and do recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Nikon70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were large and clean. A really nice buffet breakfast was provided every morning and it was very good. There is a very nice spa right next door which was terrific. I would recommend the hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Artcritic
Reviews.Content: Having stayed or at least looked at the major hotels in the Napa Valley, The Inn at Southbridge is one of the best. Clean and very well decorated rooms with fireplaces andcomfortable beds. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. Not cheap, but much, much nicer then similar hotels such as Villagio and The Vintage Inn. The combination of quality and location is hard to beat. Located within walking distance of the shops and restaurants of St Helena and in close proximity to many of the major wineries. The rooms are very pleasant and well appointed and a very nice if simple continental breakfast is served daily. The pool and spa are great. No significant negatives with the possible exception of some road noise if you stay in the rooms on the west end of the hotel or over the attached restaurant. Overall a real find in the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did not have advance reservations, but found the suite very nice and the location excellent for the local restaurants and wineries. The bathroom could use some updating (one sink, and the shower was not great). The front desk was very accomodating, and the whole feel of the hotel was comfortable. There is a spa and pool close by which we did not use. We walked to Terra and Tra Vigne. The bed was very comfortable, and the breakfast was nice, with fresh fruit, pastries, and juice.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: airpixie
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on a random Napa Valley website and thought it looked really lovely. I have to admit though, I was a bit nervous staying somewhere that had no reviews written about it... but I went ahead and booked it anyway. You would never know that this hotel even exists because it is doesn't really look like a hotel. It is quite small and is hidden (behind tons of beautiful Wisteria) even though it is just off the main street in St. Helena. We found the staff to be very friendly. The room was generous in size, nicely decorated, had a fireplace, comfortable bedding and bed. We chose a room facing the parking lot, which was slightly less expensive, but it didn't really matter in the end. The other side of the hotel looks out into a sort of courtyard/restaurant area. There was a tiny balcony looking out, but really too small to use. The continental breakfast was fairly typical, and we also dined in the Tra Vigne Pizzeria (attached to the hotel) which was great for us since we travelled with our young daughter. St. Helena was a quaint town and the hotel is in walking distance to restaurants, shopping, wine tasting, etc. I did go to the health spa (which is literally opposite the front door), which was quite small and nothing to rave about. Also, my locker had a problem and I had to go get someone to open it which was annoying, but it was nice to have the option to use their basic facilities that were included in our room rate. Our room package also came with a bottle of wine. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying here. It was our first time to the Napa Valley so I can't compare it to anywhere else there, but for a convenient location, smaller and a less tourist-y choice, the Inn at Southbridge would be a great place to stay.
